Reviews.Title: Washed Out Picture - BUT you Can Make Adjustments to Fix This Issue
Reviews.Author: Miss Cheevis
Reviews.Content: I, too, found the picture to be incredibly washed out.  None of the preset picture modes (i.e., Standard, Movie, Game, Vivid, etc.) fixed the issue. I came very close to returning the television to Costco, where I purchased it; but, since it was wall-mounted about 9' high up, I thought I had better try manually correcting the picture before going through all of that hassle . . .I found the two most important settings to adjust to fix the "washed out" picture are the Ambient Light Sensor and the Backlight Control (both of which are found by pressing the Menu button on the remote control and choosing Picture, then choosing "Custom" for the Picture Mode.  Next scroll down to "More" and scroll down to "Advanced Picture"). In this Menu, I made the following adjustments:  Noise Reduction = High  MPEG NR = High  Color Enhancement = Rich Color  Adaptive Luma = Extend  Film Mode = Auto  Backlight Control = DCR  Ambient Light Sensor = OffNext, hit the Back button on the remote control and go up to Color Temperature, changing it to "Normal."Finally, hit the Back button 2x on the remote control and adjust these settings to your liking.  I set mine as follows, but these may not work for your particular television:  Backlight = 55  Brightness = 25  Contrast = 40  Color = 85  Tint = 0  Sharpness = 20I am now completely satisfied with the picture and am glad I took the time to play with the settings to get rid of that "washed out" look.  As of this writing, though, I have only had this television for two days.  I have, however, purchased two other Vizio televisions and have had them for 2 to 3 years and am pleased with them both, so I anticipate this television, too, will be a good television for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: DGlo
Reviews.Content: I have had a Toshiba Regza 42" HD 720 since 2007. Perfect in every way. I decided to move that TV into another room and trade up to a larger screen and 1080. I have been so disappointed with this TV that I am returning it.1. The picture is washed out. I have tried every single mode and variation to get a crisp and colorful, though not harsh picture. I can't find an acceptable picture in any mode. I keep returning to the Toshiba to see a vivid, though not cartoonish, picture.2. The audio sound is awful. I wired the audio outputs to an old receiver and speakers, so this was not a deal breaker. But I don't need stereo sound to watch the news, so I used the TV's own audio. Harsh, tinny sound.3. Matte finish. The location for this TV is in a sunny room with a lot of light shining in the windows. The Toshiba never showed any reflection, always delivered a bright picture. This Vizio shows every reflection from sunlight through indoor lamps.4. Connections. Very few. I had to buy both a component splitter and additional cables to hook up my DVD player and Karaoke player.I don't know why I bought this TV. Perhaps the low price. I have a Vizio 26" HD in my bedroom and it works splendidly, so it's not the brand. I'll have to do more research to find the TV I'm looking for. In the meantime, back to the store.

Reviews.Title: Not the best, but it's ok
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I was more excited unwrapping this TV than when I turned it on. The picture is a little fuzzy and not as clear and sharp as I was hoping it would be. I'm disappointed that I wasn't excited about it for more than the 10 minutes it took me to set it up. Having said that, it's not so terrible that it's worth the trouble to package it up and return it. It's just kind of there.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: TheChamp
Reviews.Content: We found this television at Costco for $499 (mind you it is not a smart - tv) so we had to fork out the additional cash on the roku box.  Either way, we are not disappointed in either!We checked out some of the other Vizio Smart TVs and they had most of the big apps but no hbogo, and that was a deal breaker for us - so we went with the 'dumb-tv' + the roku box.I liked the minimalist look of this set, the frame is about 1/2" all the way around.  So most of what you see is the picture which we liked.The picture is very good, crisp and with nice colors. We also upgraded from a plasma and appreciate that the screen has more of a matte finish vs glossy.The only area this leaves something to be desired is the audio.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Lauren Miller
Reviews.Content: This TV was the best deal we could find out there...we paid $500 for this and it is a great tv...no complaints!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: ravonaf
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV from Costco and I paid $499. I have bought Vizio's in the past but it's been a few years. I am very happy with this purchase. I didn't need 3D or Apps (as I use a Boxee Box) so this set had everything I needed. It did take me a few days to get the video settings to my liking. It was way too dark. Once the settings where configured I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Beyond great! Will deal with again and again!
Reviews.Author: Shaun Edwards
Reviews.Content: Best purchase I have ever made on Amazon! Not just because of the tv but because of he sellers, dealing with Tim and iShopusa was a joy!I would deal with this team again and look forward to my next purchase with them! Thanks guys for making what could have been a pain and weeks of hassle a smooth and pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: Just what we were after
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: This purchase is just what we were after.  If I had to purchase again I would do so from this supplier.

Reviews.Title: Visio E461-A!
Reviews.Author: Raymond M. Goldbach
Reviews.Content: The TV is working fine and the picture is excellent.  No complaints right now on the set.  The price was outstanding.  I tried to buy another one a week later and the price went up $50.  Only gripe if any was there were no instructions on setup in the box.  I had to download them from the web.  Visio would offer no help because they said the set was a closeout from Costco.  I purchased it on Amazon from a third party seller.  Amazon said they could not help me out with the lack of instructions and that if I was unhappy I had to return the TV.  Not very happy about that.

ProductInfo.Features:
Razor LED for richer colors and more vivid details
Slim frame design with ultra thin profile beautifully enhances any living space
1080p Full HD resolution for a crystal-clear picture
A slim outer frame delivers a more immersive picture with less frame around the TV
200,000 to 1 Dynamic Contrast Ratio for deeper blacks
ProductInfo.Name: Vizio E461-A1 46-Inches Class Razor LED TV
